==Japanese==

===Etymology===
From {{compound|ja|馬|の|鼻向け|tr1=uma|tr2=no|tr3=hanamuke|t1=horse|pos2=genitive case|t3=nose pointing}}. From the practice of pointing the nose of a horse in the direction of one's destination and wishing them a safe journey.

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|うま の はなむけ}}

# seeing one off; a farewell

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|むま の はなむけ}}

# seeing one off; a farewell
#* c. 935: [[w:Tosa Nikki|Tosa Nikki]] (page 3)
#*: 藤原のときざね、船路なれど、'''馬（むま）のはなむけ'''す。
